The living conditions were... harsh.$2"/pause 800/emote farmer 60/pause 200/move Alex 0 0 1/pause 650/speak Alex "I used food to cope with my abusive father. Entries.1000005_Friends: pause 2000/move Sebastian 0 0 1/pause 300/stopMusic/pause 1000/emote Sebastian 28/pause 500/playMusic echos/pause 1000/speak Sebastian "I had a horrible nightmare last night about my dad. Not my stepdad, Demetrius. My biologcal father.$2"/pause 1500/speak Sebastian "I've never told you about him. I... I try to not think of him. It only brings back bad memories.$2"/pause 300/emote Sebastian 28/speak Sebastian "There's a reason why my mom divorced him.$2"/pause 2000/move Sebastian 0 0 3/pause 500/speak Sebastian "He was abusive, a drunk, and an addicted gambler. He even took my money from my part time job I had before I started my freelance web designing.$2"/pause 1500/speak Sebastian "My father would never take no for an answer...$2"/pause 1500/move Sebastian 0 0 1/pause 1000/emote Sebastian 28/pause 500/speak Sebastian "Eventually, my mom had enough. She was sick and tired of him stealing everything from us, so she hid our money. He...$0#$b#He didn't like that...$2"/pause 2000/speak Sebastian "I had just gotten home from school. My parents were arguing upstairs. Nothing too unusual. They would argue several times a week.$0"/pause 1000/speak Sebastian "...Then I heard glass break upstairs and screams from my mom.$2#$b#I ran upstairs as fast as I could, only to find my dad beating my mom as she laid on the floor crying...$2#$b#I instinctively ran up and punched him square in the face. I punched him so hard I broke my wrist. He fell to the floor immediately, the wind knocked out of him.$5"/pause 1000/emote Sebastian 28/pause 2000/move Sebastian 0 0 3/pause 500/speak Sebastian "My mom and I will never see him again. Good riddance.$0"/pause 1000/emote Sebastian 40/pause 500/speak Sebastian "I... I don't know why I'm telling you all this. I haven't told anyone about my dad, not even Maru.$2"/pause 1000/speak Sebastian "...$2"/pause 1000/speak Sebastian "But you know what? After talking about this... Timothy had bruises on his arm... and I... I immediately knew what had happened.$2"/pause 500/faceDirection farmer 1/emote farmer 28/pause 600/speak Penny "I didn't know what to do... If he told someone, he would be hurt again.$2"/pause 1000/shake Penny 2000/pause 650/speak Penny "I wanted to march right over to Timothy's house and scream at his father for what he did.$5#$b#But... I knew that would just cause more problems.$2"/pause 1000/emote Penny 28/pause 700/speak Penny "I finished the lesson for the day and walked the children home.$2#$b#I usually dropped Timothy off first since his house was the closest to the library, but this time I took Vincent and Jas home before him.$2"/pause 1250/speak Penny "After Jas and Vincent were safely home, I told Timothy I was going to help, and I promised that his father would never hurt him again. I promised on my life.$2"/pause 1500/speak Penny "I took Timothy to Mayor Lewis' house and explained what happened. Mayor Lewis was flabbergasted. He called the Zuzu City police and they sent a unit to Timothy's house.$2#$b#The police took his father away and they took Timothy into protective custody.$2"/pause 2000/stopAnimation Penny/faceDirection Penny 3/pause 650/speak Penny "Their house went up for sale shortly after. I don't know what else happened to Timothy, his father, or his mother, Cindy.$2#$b#Wherever Timothy is... I hope he's doing okay...$2"/pause 1000/faceDirection Penny 2/pause 1200/speak Penny "Do you think I did the right thing, @?$2"/pause 500/question fork1 "(What should I say?)#Penny, you did everything you could. You didn't understand what was truly going on in their household and you had no right."/fork 1000012_BetterNow/pause 500/stopMusic/faceDirection Penny 3/pause 250/emote Penny 12/shake Penny 999999999/pause 700/speak Penny "So, you're saying you'd idle by as an innocent child is abused by his father!?$5#$b#You are ABSOLUTELY THE WORST! Entries.1000013_KeepSecret: pause 700/speak Caroline "Thank you, @.$0"/pause 600/move Caroline 0 0 2/pause 900/move Caroline 0 0 1/pause 1200/move Caroline 0 0 3/pause 750/speak Caroline "First, you need to understand Pierre and I have a complicated relationship, but I love him, and I always will, @.$2#$b#When we were first together back when we were young, I caught Pierre fooling around with a girl in Grampleton.$2#$b#It was devastating to me when I found out. My naive self thought the appropriate response was to... fool around with someone else to get back at him.$2#$b#that other person...$2"/pause 1250/emote Caroline 28/pause 1500/speak Caroline "That other person was Rasmodius...$2"/emote farmer 16/pause 2200/speak Caroline "Pierre and I had some horrible fights and... broke up. We did get back together after a couple months.$2"/pause 1200/move Caroline 0 0 0/pause 250/emote Caroline 28/move farmer 1 0 1/emote farmer 60/pause 1700/speak Caroline "I soon discovered I was pregnant. I... I didn't know if it was Rasmodius' or Pierre's.$2#$b#I never told Pierre I saw someone else, so he had no reason to suspect if our child was his or not.$2"/pause 2000/move Caroline 0 0 3/pause 1500/speak Caroline "Ever since Abigail dyed her hair purple several years ago, it's never faded. I thought that was very strange...$2#$b#Now my daughter is seeing magical creatures in the forest and taking an interest in combating monsters...$2"/pause 2200/emote Caroline 28/pause 1000/speak Caroline "...Abigail isn't my husband's daughter. It's Rasmodius'.$2"/emote farmer 16/pause 1150/move Caroline 0 0 1/pause 1500/speak Caroline "I hadn't spoken to Rasmodius in so many years. What we had was a long, long time ago. He was surprised when I was at his doorstep.$2#$b#I told him about Abigail, and that she's his daughter. He told me he had a feeling one of the residents here in Stardew Valley was his child.$2"/pause 1500/move Caroline 0 0 0/pause 250/emote Caroline 28/pause 1700/move Caroline 0 0 3/pause 500/speak Caroline "I... I cried so much. I felt horrible that he was just now finding out he was a father.$2#$b#He made me a special drink with magical properties to calm me down and he explained what Junimos were, and why she was able to see them.$2#$b#He comforted me and gave me words of wisdom.$2"/pause 1500/speak Caroline "...$2"/pause 2000/speak Caroline "I still don't know what I'm going to tell Pierre, or if I should tell him anything at all. And then there's Abigail...$2#$b#Rasmodius told me it's up to me whether I tell Abigail about him. I appreciate that he isn't forcing me to say anything. I just... I feel horrible and guilty, @.$2"/pause 2250/move Caroline 0 0 1/pause 3000/speak Caroline "I will tell my husband and daughter, but not now. In the meantime, you MUST not tell anyone about this, @. Please...$2"/pause 500/question fork1 "(Caroline is losing her voice... what should I say?)#Caroline, I can't begin to imagine what you must be going through. I won't tell anyone about this. I swear on my grandpa's grave. If you ever need anything, don't hesitate to ask me. I'm here for you.#Pierre and Abigail deserve to know right now. If you don't tell them, I will. This is your mistake, and you need to own the consequences, Caroline. I'll also tell the whole town about this too."/fork 1000013_SwearGranpaGrave/pause 500/move Caroline 0 0 3/shake Caroline 9999999/emote Caroline 12/speak Caroline "!!!$3#$b#I TRUSTED YOU! YOU ARE THE WORST!$3"/emote farmer 28/globalFade/viewport -1000 -1000/pause 700/friendship Caroline -2500/end dialogue Caroline "I see you haven't told Pierre and Abigail yet, so what are you waiting for exactly, @?$3"
Entries.1000013_SwearGranpaGrave: pause 750/speak Caroline "... Thank you.$2"/pause 1500/move Caroline 0 0 3/pause 750/speak Caroline "I... I know that's a lot to take in, @. Thank you for promising to keep this a secret.$2#$b#When the right time comes, I'll tell Abigail about her father, M. Rasmodius. As for my husband...$2"/pause 2000/emote Caroline 28/emote farmer 60/pause 650/speak Caroline "I don't know what his reaction will be. It's going to be devasting for Pierre when I tell him Abigail isn't his daughter.$2#$b#There's a good chance we may get divorced...$2"/pause 2000/speak Caroline "...$2#$b#I'm...$2#$b#I'm happy I have a good friend like you I can talk to during times like this.$2"/pause 1500/emote Caroline 24/pause 1000/speak Caroline "I'm going to go home and go to sleep. I'm emotionally exhausted...$2"/pause 1700/move Caroline 3 0 1/pause 1800/move Caroline 0 0 3/pause 1000/speak Caroline "Have a nice night, @.$2"/move Caroline 9 0 1/pause 500/globalFade/viewport -1000 -1000/pause 700/end dialogue Caroline "Hi, @. Umm... hopefully you have a moment?$0#$b#I just wanted to say I appreciate our conversation we had by Marnie's Ranch.$2#$b#I need to think about what I'm going to tell Pierre and Abigail...$2#$b#I know it's not going to go well...$2"

Entries.1000019_Venture: pause 1000/speak Dwarf "..."/pause 1000/move Dwarf 0 0 3/pause 500/speak Dwarf "Yes. Vataku is a long forgotten mine, founded by my race. Entries.1000016_MoreAboutHim: pause 650/speak Evelyn "Of course, dear! Entries.1000023_Friends: pause 2000/speak Krobus "..."/pause 1500/move Krobus 0 0 2/pause 2000/emote Krobus 28/pause 1250/speak Krobus "One of the shadow brutes you killed in the mines was my friend, @."/emote farmer 16/emote farmer 28/pause 750/speak Krobus "His name was... Entries.1000023_AdventurerGuildOath: pause 1250/speak Krobus "... Corrupt? I don't understand..."/pause 500/question fork0 "(Continue speech)#The monsters in the mines are corrupt from ancient dark magic. It is the reason why they don't hesitate to attack and kill any non-monster that approaches them. There are countless guilds across the world that fight against this darkness. I use the resources I find to craft various devices, objects, and machines that better the lives of everyone. I... will respect your thoughts if you don't agree with me. I just wanted to give you my side of the story, Krobus."/pause 2000/move Krobus 0 1 2/pause 1000/shake Krobus 1000/pause 1000/speak Krobus "..."/pause 1750/emote Krobus 40/pause 2000/move Krobus 0 0 0/pause 1250/speak Krobus "Jasper was corrupt...#$b#That would explain why he-"/shake Krobus 2000/playSound shadowpeep/pause 500/emote farmer 16/pause 2500/speak Krobus "Knowing this brings an aching pain to my void core...#$b#I still don't know if I can forgive you for what you have done, corrupt or not."/pause 2000/move Krobus 0 0 0/pause 1500/speak Krobus "But we are close friends, @. Entries.1000025_HearYourPast: pause 1500/move Linus 0 0 2/pause 1750/move farmer 0 0 2/pause 750/emote Linus 40/pause 500/playMusic musicboxsong/pause 500/speak Linus "I moved into the valley some 30 years ago. I left everything I owned behind to become one with nature.$0#$b#My family was very wealthy. I was an only child. Money was never an issue and my parents gave me everything I ever wanted.$0#$b#I was... in a way, spoiled.$2"/pause 2000/speak Linus "I mostly kept to myself. You could say I was an introvert. I didn't have anyone in my life I would consider a close friend.$0"/pause 1500/emote Linus 28/pause 1000/speak Linus "My... parents died at a young age when I was in my mid-twenties.$2"/pause 400/move farmer 0 0 1/pause 500/emote farmer 60/pause 1500/speak Linus "I inherited their estate and their money. For a short while, I used that money to travel across the world.$0#$b#I met so many wonderful people throughout my travels. I visited just about every location in the world.$1"/pause 1750/speak Linus "One of those places I visited was Stardew Valley.$1"/pause 400/emote farmer 16/pause 1500/speak Linus "There was... a magical feeling to the valley, as if it was calling to me.$0#$b#I never felt more at home in my life. I only expected to spend a week in the valley.$1"/pause 2000/speak Linus "That week turned into months.$1#$b#The lush forests, weather, geography, the abundance of natural fruits and vegetables that grow, the seasons...$1"/pause 1500/speak Linus "I decided I wanted to stay in the valley for the rest of my life.$1"/pause 750/emote farmer 32/pause 1000/speak Linus "I donated the rest of the money and estate I inherited from my parents to many different charities and orphanages.$0#$b#If memory serves correctly, I believe it was around 3,000,000G.$1"/pause 400/emote farmer 16/pause 1250/move Linus 0 0 3/pause 500/speak Linus "I thought that money would be better suited to people who needed it more than I. Stardew Valley gives me everything I need. Money meant nothing to me.$0#$b#I learned how to live off the land and partake in the abundance of joy that nature gives us that we take for granted.$1"/pause 1000/emote Linus 40/pause 1250/speak Linus "I know deep down that my parents would be happy too. The money they worked so hard to earn was used to better the lives of thousands of others.$0#$b#And me? I have never been happier in my life.$1"/pause 1000/move Linus 0 0 2/pause 1000/move farmer 0 0 2/pause 500/playMusic spring_day_ambient/pause 2500/speak Linus "People are... quick to judge what they don't understand. Almost everyone thinks I'm a homeless bum.$2#$b#But you didn't assume that, @. You showed me compassion and kindness when we first met.$1"/pause 1500/emote farmer 32/pause 2500/question fork1 "(I know what I should say)#I never would have guessed you came from a rich family, Linus. It's incredible you gave away so much money to people who really needed it. Stardew Valley is certainly extraordinary. I'm happy my grandpa built the farm I'm using now. Never have I felt freer since living here in the valley."/pause 1500/move Linus 0 0 3/pause 500/move farmer 0 0 1/pause 500/speak Linus "I'm delighted to hear this from you.$1"/pause 650/emote farmer 32/pause 750/emote Linus 32/pause 1750/speak Linus "Well, I need to go back to my tent and gut the fish I caught.$0#$b#It will be a rewarding meal tonight.$1"/pause 1500/speak Linus "I'm happy we have become good friends over the years, @.$1#$b#I haven't told anyone about my past before.$0#$b#I trust you will keep this between us.$1"/pause 2500/speak Linus "Take care, @.$1"/pause 500/globalFade/viewport -1000 -1000/pause 700/end position 62 21

Entries.1000034/e 100162/j 14: MarlonsTheme/-500 -500/farmer 6 19 0 Marlon 6 13 2/pause 500/showFrame Marlon 7/viewport 6 14 true/skippable/playSound doorClose/pause 800/shake Marlon 600/textAboveHead Marlon "You've proven yourself!"/pause 150/move farmer 0 -4 0/pause 700/showFrame Marlon 1/pause 600/speak Marlon "You've ventured into the mines with utmost courage, @!#$b#Do you want to join the Adventurer's Guild?"/pause 1000/jump farmer/pause 800/jump farmer/pause 1800/speak Marlon "@....#$b#Do you swear under oath, to protect humanity from monsters, and to do everything in your power to uphold the traditions, values, and ideology of the Adventurer's Guild?"/pause 500/speak Marlon "$q -1 null#(Of course I will!)#$r -1 0 marlon_event1#I solemnly vow to protect humanity from monsters, and to uphold the traditions, values, and ideology of the Adventurer's Guild!"/pause 1000/move Marlon 0 1 2/pause 1000/speak Marlon "On behalf of Stardew Valley and the Order of the Knights of Pythagoras, I officially accept you as the 23rd Adventurer's Guild member!"/pause 500/jump farmer/pause 500/speak Marlon "As a member of the Adventurer's Guild, you will be allowed to purchase weapons as we procure them!#$b#There are also bounties and quests you can access from the notice board behind me!"/pause 800/emote Marlon 40/pause 1000/speak Marlon "I'm sure you have several questions as to who we are, what we do, and the history of this guild.#$b#If you would please join me in my quarters, I'll explain all of this to you, @."/pause 500/emote farmer 32/pause 1500/move farmer 0 0 1/pause 1250/emote farmer 8/pause 1000/speak Marlon "Don't mind Gil. He just took some of his meds and he is dozing off. I'll inform him of our new guild member when he awakens."/pause 500/move farmer 0 0 0/pause 1000/speak Marlon "Follow me, @."/pause 600/globalFade/viewport -1000 -1000/pause 500/warp farmer 4 5/warp Marlon 6 5/faceDirection farmer 1/showFrame Marlon 12/pause 250/viewport 7 6 true/pause 1500/speak Marlon "Hmm... where to begin..."/pause 1500/emote Marlon 40/pause 500/speak Marlon "I'll start with the history of the guild.#$b#I founded the Adventurer's Guild over 25 years ago, after being recognized by the Order of the Knights of Pythagoras.#$b#This Order you now belong to is made up of over fifty guilds and clans around the world in every continent.#$b#Our mission is to protect humanity from monsters corrupted from ancient dark magic. To this day, no one is sure as of why monsters are corrupted like this..."/pause 1700/speak Marlon "There are ancient legends of a past time where monsters and humans lived in peace. These times have been... long forgotten.#$b#So, we the Order of the Knights of Pythagoras, have sworn an oath to protect humans from monsters. We are, in a way, monster hunters."/pause 500/emote farmer 16/pause 1000/speak Marlon "This guild in particular works closely with M. Rasmodius. You may know him as the 'Wizard'.#$b#Every guild has a wizard or witch that supports them. It's paramount our weapons are imbued with magic to pierce the life force of monsters."/pause 1500/emote Marlon 40/pause 700/speak Marlon "You may wonder why we use swords instead of guns. In order to destroy the life force of a monster, you must pierce its life force fibers in a slashing movement.#$b#This is the only way to insure the monster is killed, or else it will simply regenerate.#$b#Projectile weapons unfortunately don't do the trick. They are able to stun monsters, but they will still require a good horizontal slash to finish them off.#$b#If you ever use a projectile based weapon, you may understand what I mean."/pause 2000/speak Marlon "Alesia was a gifted sniper, preferring a bow that used magic imbued arrows. She used to be a member of this guild before she moved to Castle Village in the desert.#$b#She used her arrows to stun monsters before finishing them with her dagger."/pause 1000/showFrame Marlon 0/pause 800/showFrame Marlon 4/pause 1000/speak Marlon "We used to have many more members. Over time, people have left to join other guilds and... and we..."/pause 1250/emote Marlon 28/pause 1000/emote farmer 60/pause 1250/speak Marlon "We have lost a lot of good people over the years, @. What we do is dangerous, and it's a thankless job.#$b#I need you to understand there is a chance you may be killed."/pause 800/speak Marlon "$q -1 null#(I know what I should say)#$r -1 0 marlon_event2#Marlon, I am fully aware of the risks. If I felt any other way, I wouldn't had ventured into the mines to prove myself to you that I am capable of being an Adventurer's Guild member. I believe I can make a difference in this guild and help protect people in the valley."/pause 1000/showFrame Marlon 0/pause 1000/showFrame Marlon 12/pause 500/speak Marlon "It makes me proud hearing this from you, @. You have the potential to be an excellent swordsman."/pause 1250/speak Marlon "We first met at the mines of Corneal Mountain. You may be wondering why we don't just seal off the entrance to the mines.#$b#Unfortunately, Joja owns the rights to the mines and won't allow us to seal it.#$b#It's strange. They don't utilize the mines in any way, despite bountiful amounts of ore.#$b#Because of this, we must venture into the mines and slay monsters before they accumulate in mass. I see you have already started!"/pause 1500/speak Marlon "The furthest floor we have made it to in the mines is floor 93. I would like to see you beat that record, @."/pause 800/speak Marlon "$q -1 null#(What should I say?)#$r -1 0 marlon_event3#I'll make it past that floor! Just you watch!#$r -1 0 marlon_event4#That's very deep in the mines. There must be strong monsters waiting down there..."/pause 1500/speak Marlon "At some point, we should go over the types of species of monsters you may encounter, and what their weaknesses are."/pause 1500/speak Marlon "And also... that not every monster is corrupted and hostile.#$b#There is a shadow brute that lives in the sewer. His name is 'Krobus'.#$b#If you ever meet Krobus, don't draw your weapon on him."/pause 600/emote farmer 36/pause 1000/speak Marlon "Well, I believe that is enough conversation for you today. I will speak with you again soon on other matters.#$b#I need to check on a new stock of weapons we just received."/pause 1200/speak Marlon "Once again, welcome to the guild, @. I expect great things from you."/pause 500/emote farmer 32/pause 500/globalFade/viewport -1000 -1000/pause 700/end dialogue Marlon "How is adventuring?"

Entries.elliott_event5: No worries, @! I just thought I'd offer. Perhaps some other time!$1

Entries.sam_event1: Yeah, no kidding it is. It's nice to hear we're both in the same boat.$1
Entries.sam_event2: Whoa! Get out of town. That's crazy! You're lucky you got that arcade machine. That's worth like… 15,000G at least!$8
Entries.sam_event3: Oh... well, that's alright. To each their own, I guess.$2

Entries.shane_event2: Why am I at the railroad? Pondering about some things...$3
Entries.shane_event3: Heh, nothing gets past you does it?$3

Entries.abigail_event1: I thought I was the only one who could see them! This is crazy!$7
Entries.abigail_event2: I thought I was the only one who could see them! This is crazy!$7
Entries.abigail_event3: That's... that's a good idea.$2#$b#Sorry, I'm still trying to calm down. Ummm... let me think of a question.$0
Entries.abigail_event4: Umm... I do. let me think... oh, so...$6
Entries.abigail_event5: The wizard told you? I've never met the wizard before...$9
Entries.abigail_event6: I see. Maybe I could look at that book sometime too.$0
Entries.abigail_event7: She is! Apples is very vocal. She's always excited to see me when I visit the forest.$1
Entries.abigail_event8: Umm... about a year ago, I think? I came to the forest to practice a song I was learning, and these little spirits confronted me.$6#$b#At first, I was scared. I thought they were going to hurt me... but Apples was the first Junimo to convey to me that they're peaceful.$0
Entries.abigail_event9: That's funny, you thought they were rats! I perceived them as walking apples, hence why I gave Apples that name.$1
Entries.abigail_event10: Oh, that's a long time ago. It makes me wonder if I stumbled across them when I was younger too.$9#$b#Maybe I did... but I can't remember that far back.$2
Entries.abigail_event11: I can't read the language...$2#$b#I've seen the characters that make up the language, though.$6#$b#Apples has drawn the language on the ground for me and she's pointed to stone slabs written in it.$0#$b#I knew she was trying to tell me something, but I couldn't understand it...$2
Entries.abigail_event12: I did tell my mom and she was... shocked?$2#$b#She told me to think nothing of it and that I'm just seeing things. She sounded condescending.$9#$b#I also told Sebastian. He laughed at me.$3
Entries.abigail_event13: The wizard? Interesting... I don't know that much about him.$6#$b#My mom always told me to not talk to him. She even forbids me to go near his tower. I never understood why...$2
Entries.abigail_event14: The wizard? Interesting... I don't know that much about him.$6#$b#My mom always told me to not talk to him. She even forbids me to go near his tower. I never understood why...$2

Entries.clint_event3: I also have hiked up there myself. Some of those adventurers had quite the kill count on their tombstones. They were fine people.$0

Entries.demetrius_event1: Robin told me about some new buildings she built on your farm. I hope they're working out for you!$1
Entries.demetrius_event2: That's a smart idea! Automating a process will surely save you time for other productive activities!$1
Entries.demetrius_event3: I ran into Marlon recently and he told me you're an Adventurer's Guild member.$0#$b#You must show promise as a skilled swordsman!$1
Entries.demetrius_event5: Haha! You tried to guess at least, @.$1

Entries.dwarf_event3: I'm pleased that you agree with me, @.
Entries.dwarf_event4: Perhaps... but it is still used in a way that causes death and destruction, @.

Entries.evelyn_event1: My day is well. It's a bit on the chilly side, though.$0
Entries.evelyn_event2: Be sure to wear several layers, sweetie! I wouldn't want you catching a cold.$0
Entries.evelyn_event3: That's unfortunate to hear, dear. I'm optimistic that your day will brighten up.$0

Entries.gus_event1: She was here a moment ago. She left to run some errands though.$0
Entries.gus_event2: I see! I was just there. Willy is fishing on the dock right now.$1
Entries.gus_event3: It is certainly a chilly morning, especially with the ocean breeze!$0
Entries.gus_event4: I always make the effort to visit Sophia when I have free time. She really appreciates it.$2
Entries.gus_event5: Hmm... that's why Sophia hates Joja.$2#$b#She... blames them for the death of her parents.$2

Entries.jodi_event1: ... Yes. You're right.$2#$b#I need to be supportive for Kent. We are in this together, and I need to do everything I can to help him. Thank you, @.$2
Entries.jodi_event2: Thank you for the idea, @.$2#$b#I'll talk to doctor Harvey about this. I'm sure he has some contacts he could recommend.$2

Entries.kent_event4: OUR NATION HAS COMMITTED COUNTLESS ATTROCITIES! WE'VE KILLED THOUSANDS OF GOTORO CIVILIANS!$3
Entries.kent_event5: OUR NATION HAS COMMITTED COUNTLESS ATTROCITIES! WE'VE KILLED THOUSANDS OF GOTORO CIVILIANS!$3
Entries.kent_event6: MY PLATOON WAS DECIMATED IN AN AMBUSH! I WAS A COWARD!!!$3
Entries.kent_event7: MY PLATOON WAS DECIMATED IN AN AMBUSH! I WAS A COWARD!!!$3

Entries.lewis_event1: That is wonderful to hear, @!$1#$b#The residents of Pelican Town would truly appreciate it.$0#$b#You can get right to work on the field, @. Thank you.$1
Entries.lewis_event2: That's fine, @. My offer still stands if you decide to change your mind later.$0#$b#If you do change your mind, you can get right to work on the field.$0

Entries.linus_event1: I'm happy to hear that.$1#$b#I caught some fish this morning. Dinner tonight will be a wonderful meal.$0
Entries.linus_event2: Great to hear you're having a productive day.$1#$b#I caught some fish this morning. Dinner tonight will be a wonderful meal.$0
Entries.linus_event3: Haha, I see. Those days are certainly the best.$1#$b#I caught some fish this morning. Dinner tonight will be a wonderful meal.$0

Entries.marnie_event1: That's great to hear! I also get my seeds from Pierre.$1
Entries.marnie_event2: Aww, that's wonderful to hear, @. I'm happy you're treating them well.$1
Entries.marnie_event3: Oh, wow! That sounds like a lot of work, @!$1

Entries.vincent_event1: They do! I sometimes find some myself that Willy buys from me.$0#$b#It's enough to buy some ice cream or some games of Prairie King at the arcade.$1
Entries.vincent_event2: I like ocean creatures a lot! These tide pools allow me to get a good close look of all sorts of them!$0

Entries.willy_event1: Good to hear you're still in the spirit of fishing, @.$0#$b#I'm happy I gave you my old fishing rod to get you started!$1
Entries.willy_event2: That is marvelous to hear, @! I'm happy I gave you my old fishing rod to get you started!$1#$b#I never knew you had this much potential to be a skilled angler.$1
Entries.willy_event3: That's unfortunate to hear, @. Hopefully you'll pick up fishing again soon!$0

Entries.marlon_event4: Yes, there are. The further down you go, the more monsters you'll encounter that have been...#$b#That have been corrupted for many years. It gives them supernatural strength.

Entries.2481135/f Alex 1000/t 900 1600: sweet/-1000 -1000/farmer 44 65 1 Alex 50 68 1/skippable/viewport 53 67 true/pause 3000/speak Alex "That's a good boy, Dusty."/pause 2000/speak Alex "You might be the only one around here who understands me.$s#$b#No one else has seen the kind of stuff you and I have.$s"/faceDirection Alex 2/pause 700/emote Alex 28/playSound leafrustle/move farmer 6 0 2/pause 500/faceDirection Alex 0/jump Alex/pause 800/speak Alex "@! Did you overhear me talking?$7"/move farmer 0 1 2/question fork1 "#Yes, I heard everything.#Not really... why?"/fork didntHear/pause 500/faceDirection Alex 2/pause 1000/showFrame Alex 27/pause 600/playMusic desolate/emote Alex 28/speak Alex "I don't really like to talk about it, but I guess I'll explain...$s"/pause 1000/showFrame Alex 0 true/faceDirection Alex 0/pause 500/speak Alex "Have you ever wondered why I live with my grandparents?$s#$b#You see, my father wasn't a good guy... he... well, he ruined everything for me and my mom.$a#$b#Half the time he was gone... the other half he'd drink all night and tell me I'm worthless, that I'd never amount to anything.$a#$b#I think he resented me for being young... bitter because he'd wasted his youth doing nothing and had gotten nowhere in life."/faceDirection Alex 1/speak Alex "Well... that's my take on it, anyway. Who knows what was going on in his mind.$a"/pause 800/speak Alex "One day he left, and soon after that Mom got sick and passed away. I had no choice but to move in with my grandparents.$s"/move farmer 0 1 1/pause 3000/emote Alex 40/faceDirection Alex 0/playMusic spring_day_ambient/speak Alex "You seem like someone I can trust... that's why I'm telling you this, @. I don't want any sympathy.$s#$b#If there's one good thing about my past, it's that it made me strong."/pause 500/faceDirection farmer 2/pause 3000/speak Alex "I'm going to... think about some things for a bit, @.$2"/pause 1200/speak Alex "I'll catch you later.$0"/pause 600/globalFade/viewport -1000 -1000/end

Entries.Pierre: Happy Spirits Eve, @!$h#$b#This maze was constructed by that wizard that lives in the woods. Apparently, there's two treasure chests in the maze that have a bountiful amount of goodies in them!$0#$e#I also heard there are monsters in the maze... So that'll be a no go for me.$s#$b#Best of luck to you if you venture forth in there, @!$h
Entries.Wizard: Hello, @. Have you entered the maze yet? I put in some surprises in there for anyone who dares enter it.#0#$e#I might have gone a little overboard with the monsters in the maze!$h
Entries.Linus: Hi, @. I hope this evening is treating you well.$0#$b#These shadow brutes in particular are of the vicious type. If given the opportunity, they would rip the limbs off your body!$3#$e#Not all shadow brutes are savages like these one here, though.$0#$b#I'm good friends with one that goes by the name of 'Krobus'. He's quite the charming fellow!$h#$e#Enjoy the rest of your evening, @!$0

Entries.Forest.5: It's Marnie's shipping bin. There's fresh crops and animal produce in here!
Entries.Forest.7: There's various produce stored in here.
Entries.Forest.9: Leah grows her own food! How resourceful!
Entries.Forest.10: Leah must love flowers. These flower beds are in excellent shape.
Entries.Forest.12: You think to yourself that maybe, just maybe there's something magical about this place. Hmm...
Entries.Forest.13: ` Pelican Town^@ Fairhaven Farm^> Blue Moon Vineyard^
Entries.Forest.14: Looks like someone has been drinking alcohol here. You notice the "Stardrop Saloon" logo on the bottles.
Entries.Forest.15: There are alcohol bottles down there. Whoever has been drinking here is throwing bottles off the cliff.
Entries.Forest.17: It's a trash can! You want to look in it, but it's locked tight. Apparently, someone has been snooping around the area going through everyone's trash cans. Probably just raccoons.
Entries.Forest.20: It's a bunch of flower beds. They are well taken care of.
Entries.Forest.21: Andy collects honey from these bee houses.
Entries.Forest.23: This farm house is abandoned. You can see a large collection of various hats inside, though.
Entries.Forest.24: Looks like a tiny garage. Farming equipment used to be stored here.
Entries.Forest.25: This crop field is completely overgrown...
Entries.Forest.26: An alcohol bottle?... Someone has been drinking and littering here recently.
Entries.Forest.27: Marnie's silo has 214/240 bushels of hay in it.
Entries.Forest.28: Eww... this green slime smells like death.
Entries.Forest.29: There's bushels of hay everywhere. Marnie probably sells the excess amounts.
Entries.Forest.30: It's Andy's shipping bin. Fresh forage is in here! He must have gathered some from the forest recently.
Entries.Forest.31: These boxes have a lot of seeds in them. You notice the Joja Co. logo on the seed bags...
Entries.Forest.32: Marnie uses this tiny crop field to grow trellis crops during spring, summer, and fall.
Entries.Forest.34: You look at yourself in the reflection of the water. You're looking dapper today!
Entries.Forest.35: Marnie is storing her produce in these barrels.
Entries.Forest.36: Various crop seeds are in these crates. You notice "Pierre's General Store" logo on all of the seed bags. Marnie doesn't shop at Joja for her seeds!
Entries.Forest.37: This swing is tied to a large branch on this beautiful tree. Shane must have built this swing here for Jas to play with!
Entries.Forest.38: You feel a magical presence here.
Entries.Forest.39: There are some seed bags in this crate. They are from Pierre's shop! Leah doesn't shop at Joja!
Entries.Forest.40: There's some sort of invisible barrier preventing you from going over there.
Entries.Forest.41: It's the remains of a campfire.
Entries.Forest.43: What's a grave doing all the way out here in the forest? It's very old and faded. The descriptions are impossible to read...^You notice an arrow pointing down and to the left.
Entries.Forest.44: Marnie uses home-made fertilizer for her flower beds!
Entries.Forest.45: You look in the trash thinking you'd find something good. All you find is trash. You don't know what you expected.
Entries.Forest.46: There's empty tube paint and various scrapped projects in here. You wonder what Leah is currently working on in her house.
Entries.Forest.47: There's nothing in here except rotten food and used Joja products.
Entries.Forest.48: There's rotten food stuffed in this bottle...
Entries.Forest.50: Everything here is magical because it's right next to the Wizard's tower. Makes sense, right?
Entries.Forest.51: If a tree falls in a forest and no one is around to hear it, does it make a sound?
Entries.Forest.52: Some tools are stored in here. Andy has an iron axe!
Entries.Forest.53: It's a seed maker. Andy must use this to get extra seeds from his excess crops.
Entries.Forest.55: Oh, this is a cheese press! Marnie makes some of the best cheese in the valley.
Entries.Forest.57: Looks like this is used to make mayonnaise. Shane's chickens produce high quality eggs that get turned into mayonnaise.
Entries.Forest.58: Some of these barrels have various artisan goods in them. Others have farming equipment!
Entries.Forest.59: This bucket is filled with fertilizer.
Entries.Forest.60: Does Marnie cut wood? Or does Shane? Hmm...
Entries.Forest.62: You shouldn't wonder too deep into the forest...
Entries.PelicanTown.1: This is the Pelican Town Fountain. You can see various coins in the water.
Entries.PelicanTown.2: Jas and Vincent play here during the weekends. You notice a small plaque on the ground that reads: "FUNDED BY THE MERRYCHESTER FUNDRAISER".
Entries.PelicanTown.3: Pierre sure does know how to showcase his shop.
Entries.PelicanTown.4: Looks like Jodi decorated this lamp post with some flower beds.
Entries.PelicanTown.5: Emily and Haley have a clean and tidy backyard. Hmm... You notice something off to the right...
Entries.PelicanTown.6: Oh, it's just a garden gnome.
Entries.PelicanTown.7: This soil has a high-grade fertilizer.
Entries.PelicanTown.8: "ADVENTURER'S GUILD"^There's bright purple star with golden snakes weaving in and out of it. This must be the Adventurer's Guild Crest.
Entries.PelicanTown.9: You can see a supplies pack and various weapons in the boat. There's also a bow under the seat.
Entries.PelicanTown.10: "DEWEY"^"He was only a cat, but he was human enough to be a great comfort in hours of loneliness and pain."
Entries.PelicanTown.11: Mayor Lewis has an impressive garden!
Entries.PelicanTown.12: The Pelican Town Community Garden is remarkable! There's a variety of crops that are grown throughout the year. The produce is used for the various festivals that are held.
Entries.PelicanTown.13: This machine runs off of coal. It can't be good for the air quality... it really stinks.
Entries.PelicanTown.14: There are several furnaces and a charcoal kiln.
Entries.PelicanTown.15: I wish I could go over there... perhaps the mod author will update this mod in the future, allowing me to explore this area?
Entries.PelicanTown.16: This community park is well taken care of! You notice a plaque on the bench. It reads:^"FUNDED AND BUILT IN RECOGNITION OF STARDEWVALLEY'S ACHIEVEMENTS BY THE MAYOR OF ZUZU CITY"
Entries.PelicanTown.17: There's a lot of shopping baskets.
Entries.PelicanTown.18: These Joja trucks are blocking Pelican Town's natural hot springs. Was this done on purpose?...
Entries.PelicanTown.20: Pam probably left these alcohol bottles here...
Entries.PelicanTown.21: This truck hasn't budged in ages...
Entries.PelicanTown.22: This little shrine has existed well before Pelican Town was built. It makes you smile knowing it wasn't destroyed when the Community Center was constructed.
Entries.PelicanTown.24: These barrels have monster parts in them...
Entries.PelicanTown.25: These crates have a variety of ores in them.
Entries.PelicanTown.26: This crate is filled with seeds from Joja.
Entries.PelicanTown.27: Jodi grows trellis crops all year around.
Entries.PelicanTown.28: There's a lot going on in his backyard.
Entries.PelicanTown.29: This crate is filled with coal.
Entries.PelicanTown.30: These crates have seeds from Pierre's in them. It fills you with joy knowing that Pelican Town supports their local businesses.
Entries.PelicanTown.31: This scarecrow protects the crops from crows!
Entries.PelicanTown.32: Bee houses galore! The honey harvested here is used in a variety of dishes for festivals.
Entries.PelicanTown.33: There are many trellis crops that are planted here all year around.
Entries.PelicanTown.34: You suddenly are craving ice cream.
Entries.PelicanTown.35: This swing was made for Jas and Vincent.
Entries.PelicanTown.36: These flower beds are fake... Joja probably cut costs on hiring a gardener.
Entries.PelicanTown.37: This is Pierre's personal garden! He uses the highest quality fertilizer and seeds.
Entries.PelicanTown.38: Pierre uses seeds from Joja!? Wait, you misread the label. Of course Pierre doesn't use their seeds!
Entries.PelicanTown.39: It's Pierre's seed maker. It was imported all the way from the Fern Islands! This is top quality.
Entries.PelicanTown.40: It's Pierre's shipping bin. There's nothing in here at the moment. Lewis might have came by recently! Not surprising considering he lives right around the corner.
Entries.PelicanTown.41: Pierre is fermenting wine in these kegs!
Entries.PelicanTown.42: You try to open the door, but it's locked... there's also a sign that says "NO SOLICITING"
Entries.PelicanTown.43: You notice something to the left...
Entries.PelicanTown.44: Oh, it's a sign that says "NO TRESPASSING".
Entries.PelicanTown.46: Evelyn prides herself in decorating the town square!
Entries.PelicanTown.47: Gus makes the best Shooting Comet cocktail. He always adds a little extra vodka in it!
Entries.PelicanTown.48: Just incase you weren't aware there's a dog, here's a sign in bright red text that reads: "DOG"
Entries.PelicanTown.49: There's a plethora of wood stored in this backyard... You notice a horrible stench from behind the house...
Entries.PelicanTown.50: Residents here in Pelican Town use these kegs and barrels to turn their produce into wine and jelly!
Entries.PelicanTown.51: Mayor Lewis has a boring backyard...
Entries.PelicanTown.52: Evelyn takes good care of this flower bed!
Entries.Beach.1: This wreckage has been here for whats seems like years...
Entries.Beach.3: This is Willy's boat. There's multiple fishing poles and various bait underneath the seat.
Entries.Beach.4: This bench is worn from the salty air.
Entries.Beach.5: It's a fish basket! There's nothing in here at the moment.
Entries.Beach.6: You stare out into the endless ocean. You can faintly see the Fern Islands across the Gem Sea.
Entries.Beach.7: Elliott stores his fish in these baskets sometimes. He's an excellent fisherman, rivaling Willy!
Entries.Beach.8: This statue resembles an ocean bird.
Entries.Mountain.1: There's nothing but junk in this basket.
Entries.Mountain.2: Linus has his clothes in this crate.
Entries.Mountain.3: There's some dry food stuffs and rations in here.
Entries.Mountain.5: It's amazing Robin built this house all by herself! She is truly a master carpenter in her trade.
Entries.Mountain.6: This statue reminds you of the Ewocs from Planet Wars episode six.
Entries.Mountain.7: You can see the lab Demetrius and Maru work in.
Entries.Mountain.8: It's at least a 20 meter drop to the bottom...
Entries.Mountain.9: There's nothing but stone in this barrel.
Entries.Mountain.10: This barrel is half full with coal.
Entries.Mountain.11: There's a several geodes in here along with some precious gems and ores! Better leave them here for the person who mined them.
Entries.RailRoad.1: @ Bathhouse^> Emerald Farm^` Train Station^` Summit
Entries.RailRoad.3: It's a pile of random barrels and boxes. Susan stores a lot of farming equipment here.
Entries.RailRoad.4: Eww... why did I look in here? What the heck was I thinking!?
Entries.RailRoad.5: It's a railroad crossing sign. Make sure to look both ways and to watch out for trains!
Entries.RailRoad.6: It's a little worn from age... but you can just make out that it says this is "Barin's" tombstone. You also notice the Adventurer's Guild Crest on the bottom of the tombstone.
Entries.RailRoad.7: Hmm... it's too faded to make out what it says. Looking to the side, you notice there's a rusty sword hilt poking out of the grass.
Entries.RailRoad.8: This tombstone belongs to a famous adventurer named^"RED SCAR". There's a tiny description saying that he slayed over 1,000 slimes and received a special enchanted ring.
Entries.RailRoad.9: It's impossible to read the writing... but you can vaguely see an Adventurer Guild Crest on the tombstone hidden by the overgrown grass.
Entries.RailRoad.10: There's writing in an Elvish language. Unfortunately, you don't understand Elvish so you can't read the descriptions on the gravestone. Looking down, you notice there's another Adventurer Guild Crest.
Entries.RailRoad.11: "BEAR CLAW"^"SLIMES:853 BATS:97 BUGS:628 SHADOW BRTUES:84".....^^The list continues on. It would appear this is how many confirmed kills this adventurer had.
Entries.RailRoad.12: This is Emerald Farm's crop field. The produce grown here is shipped to various provinces around the Ferngill Republic.
Entries.RailRoad.13: You wonder when the next train will come through Stardew Valley.
Entries.RailRoad.14: There's nothing but trash in here. you don't know what you expected.
Entries.RailRoad.15: It's Susan's shipping bin. There's nothing in here right now. Lewis might have dropped by recently.
Entries.RailRoad.16: These seeds came all the way from Chestervale. Susan gets her seeds via import.
Entries.RailRoad.17: This is where Susan cuts her wood.
Entries.RailRoad.18: Susan takes great care of her flower beds!
Entries.RailRoad.19: You were about to pull the sword out of the ground, but you realize you should respect whoever laid their weapon here.
Entries.RailRoad.20: It's a rusty sword. Looks like it's been here for decades.
Entries.RailRoad.21: The name "GERTA" is on this grave. Most of the descriptions are too worn from age to read them...
Entries.RailRoad.22: Susan grows her trellis crops with this field. She uses a unique home made fertilizer for them.
Entries.Summit.1: "In loving memory of ISABELLE"^"Beloved wife, mentor, and adventurer"^"May you rest in peace, my flower."
Entries.Summit.2: Stardew Valley looks incredible from up here! What a spectacular view!
Entries.Summit.3: This is a... thing! Yes! A thing!
Entries.Summit.4: You want to sit on this bench and enjoy the amazing view but your character doesn't have a sitting animation.
Entries.Desert.2: These baby cactuses are well taken care of! Sandy is doing is great job.
Entries.Desert.3: At first, you thought there might have been a snake in this vase. Fortunately, there's nothing but sand in it.
Entries.Desert.4: Looking across the oasis, you see tall mountains. The other side of those mountains is where Stardew Valley is!
Entries.Desert.5: It looks like someone recently damaged the building on purpose. They might have lost money gambling...
Entries.Desert.6: This cactus doesn't skip leg day.
Entries.Desert.7: This cactus is huge! Knowing that this cactus will continue to grow larger fills you with determination.
Entries.Desert.8: Looking down the road you can see Castle Village! It fills you with joy knowing that the mod author will someday add this location for you to explore.
Entries.Desert.9: You tried picking up the forage, but instead it prickled your hand. You decide to leave the forage where it is.
Entries.Desert.10: This is an ancient temple of some kind. These statues must be well over 200 years old.
Entries.Desert.11: These are the bones of an ancient dragon. Dragons existed before humans, elfs, dwarfs, even the shadow people. No one knows why they went extinct.
Entries.Desert.12: Skull Cavern... you recall Marlon's stories of other adventurers who went forth into this cave, never to return...
Entries.Desert.13: You shouldn't wander too far into the desert...
Entries.Desert.14: You can see Stardew Valley down the road!
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.1: > Beach^@ Blue Moon Vineyard^@ Cindersap Forest^
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.3: You look in this trash can and find empty wine bottles. You figure you can't sell these bottles, so you leave them in the trash can.
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.4: There's nothing but grape seeds in these boxes. They're all from Pierre's General Store!
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.5: Blue Moon Vineyard is huge! Look at all these grape trellis! This vineyard has been here for many years.
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.6: Blue Moon Vineyard turns all the grapes it harvests into wine. Some of these kegs ferment for months, while others ferment for years. The wine is sold to multiple provinces in the Ferngill Republic and here in Stardew Valley!
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.7: You take a peek in Sophia's shipping bin. Whoa!!! There's iridium quality wine in here!
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.8: This swing is worn from age.
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.9: These bee houses are well taken care of!
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.10: This chest is locked tight. You only wanted to know what was in it...
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.11: Grapes are cleaned and stomped in this stone well. They are then placed in kegs with a special wine yeast to ferment!
Entries.BlueMoonVineyard.12: You feel the ocean breeze on your face.
Entries.LostWoods.1: You don't recognize the language these descriptions are written in... but it does show arrows pointing to mushrooms through numerous trees.
Entries.LostWoods.2: These ruins must be over 100 years old.
Entries.LostWoods.3: What is this tree doing all the way in the forest? There's no possible way it could survive with so little sun light... And it appears to be very ancient.
Entries.LostWoods.4: You wanted to read the descriptions on this grave, but its in Elvish. You can't read Elvish.
Entries.LostWoods.5: It's too worn from age to make out what it says...
Entries.LostWoods.6: "KONKOR"^"Shu nok vu dun leim kunar varim"^^...Hmm, this language isn't Elvish or Dwarfish. What could it possibly be?
Entries.LostWoods.7: Someone left this here recently. But who?
Entries.LostWoods.8: "VUNOK"^... The descriptions are in a language you've never seen before, so you can't understand it.
Entries.LostWoods.9: This grave has large scratch marks on it, erasing what the descriptions say.
Entries.LostWoods.12: This sword has Elvish engravings on it
Entries.LostWoods.13: This grave is written in Elvish, and you don't understand the language, but you try to read the descriptions anyway:^^"Laurie lantar lassi surinen, yeni unotime ve ramar aldaron! Yeni ve linte uldar avanier mi oromari lisse-miruvoreva Andune pella, Vardo tellumar nu luini yassen tintilar i eleni omaryo airetari lirinen. Si man i yulma nin enquantuva? An si Tintalle Varda Oiolosseo ve fanyar maryat Elentari ortane."
Entries.LostWoods.14: It's a Dwarfish sword. It looks very heavy...
Entries.LostWoods.15: This language is in Junimo, but you can read Junimo!^"To he or she who has entered our village, we the Junimo, welcome you! If it is exotic goods you seek, we will trade goods for yellow sparkly rocks. If it's civilization you wish to pursue, the teleportation crystal will send you back to once you came."
Entries.LostWoods.16: These trees are growing fruit you've never seen before. You wonder what they are?
Entries.LostWoods.17: The Junimo have many ancient fruit plants everywhere. You want to take some, but you aren't a thief. Maybe they will sell you some seeds?
Entries.LostWoods.18: Hmm... yeah. Definitely magic. You're sure of it.
Entries.LostWoods.19: You look across the lake and you spot a dozen more Junimo huts. You even see some of the Junimo outside of their huts! Seeing the community of Junimos fills you with determination.
Entries.TownEast.2: You can see the town of Grampleton across the bridge. Unfortunately, the mod author hasn't created this area yet so you can't visit the town...
Entries.TownEast.3: You want to sit on the bench, but your character doesn't have a sitting animation to use it.
Entries.TownEast.4: This tree must be over 100 years old.
Entries.TownEast.5: It's a shovel. These tools are used to dig up stuff like dirt. Wasn't that informative?
Entries.TownEast.6: Lewis will clear away these boxes and barrels when he's ready to help you cultivate this field. You should focus on your farm in the meantime!
Entries.MarnieShed.1: Marnie is storing various stuff here.
Entries.MarnieShed.2: This must be where Marnie keeps track of her profits and supplies.
Entries.MarnieShed.3: These cheese presses are hard a work!
Entries.MarnieShed.4: Marnie's looms are hand-crafted from Grampleton. They craft some of the best wood equipment there!
Entries.MarnieShed.5: These are pictures of Marnie's farm when it was first built. Marnie looked so young, and thinner!
Entries.MarnieShed.6: There's beer in here. Is this Shane's keg?
Entries.MarnieShed.7: Eww... these haven't been washed yet. They smell like rotten eggs.
Entries.MarnieShed.8: "MANIFEST 3608.25.01-43"^^"EXPENSES: 46,720G"^"INCOME: 94,351G"^"PROFITS FOR 43RD QUARTER: 47,631G"^^"ANIMALS: 14 COWS, 8 SHEEP, 6 PIGS, 18 CHICKENS"^^"SHIPMENT 44.02-1"^"900 GALLONS-MILK"^"120 KG-CHEESE"^"25 KG-WOOL"^"70 KG-PRODUCE"
Entries.MarnieShed.9: The chest is unlocked! You open the chest to see what's inside of it to satsify your curiosity... only to find another chest that is locked...
Entries.SophiaHouse.3: You look in the fridge... Wow, there's a lot of orange chicken in here. Sophia must love this stuff.
Entries.SophiaHouse.5: The sink has a plate with leftover orange chicken sauce on it. It hasn't been cleaned yet.
Entries.SophiaHouse.6: It's a table for three, but there's only a single placemat. Hmm...
Entries.SophiaHouse.7: Whoa, this is a GE 30 Slide-In Electric Range Stove! This must have been expensive!
Entries.SophiaHouse.8: It's a gameboard table! Inside the table are several other board games. This looks like Settlers of Ferngill, with three players. The game pieces are dusty though... And it doesn't look like they've moved from this spot in a while...
Entries.SophiaHouse.14: "Viticulture: An Introduction to Commercial Grape Growing for Wine Production"
Entries.SophiaHouse.17: This looks like EVA foam. Sophia must be making some armor for cosplay.
Entries.SophiaHouse.19: It's a large collection of different fabrics.
Entries.SophiaHouse.20: Sophia is working on a cosplay project. You wonder what it could possibly be?
Entries.SophiaHouse.21: You take a look at the sheet of paper... Hmm, there's notes on complex sewing and stitching patterns.
Entries.SophiaHouse.22: It's a collection of various dyes.
Entries.SophiaHouse.23: There's moving boxes outside of this room.
Entries.SophiaHouse.24: It's an old pillow, covered with dust.
Entries.SophiaHouse.25: This bed has a fine layer of dust on it. It hasn't been used in forever.
Entries.SophiaHouse.26: Dust is all over this couch...
Entries.SophiaHouse.28: It's a ripped piece from a newspaper titled:^"BREAKING NEWS: STARDEW VALLEY PARENTS, OWNERS OF BLUE MOON VINE-"^... Hmm, it cuts off. You're unable to read the rest of it.
Entries.SophiaHouse.29: Sophia takes good care of her plants.
Entries.SophiaHouse.30: There's a bunch of manga books on the floor.
Entries.SophiaHouse.31: Whoa! Sophia has an NVIDIA RIVA 128 graphics card!
Entries.SophiaHouse.32: There's several limited edition Tofu Anime dolls on the shelf. These are so cute!
Entries.SophiaHouse.35: You really shouldn't... but you decide to take a look in the dresser. Hmm, there's undies and socks in this drawer. You now feel guilty for looking in here.
Entries.SophiaHouse.36: There's various creams, lotions and makeup palettes.
Entries.SophiaHouse.37: It's a ripped piece of paper from what looks like Sophia's diary. You know you shouldn't read it, but your curiosity gets the better of you:^^"Mom... dad... I miss you both so much... there isn't a single day that goes by where I don't think about you two. I sometimes don't think I have the strength to go on... but I have a responsibility to take care of the vineyard you two worked so hard to create. I'm maintaining the vineyard just fine and I just recently built some bee houses. I also got a new contract with a vendor who wants to buy thirty crates of iridium quality wine every season. Money isn't an issue for me... I just... I just wish you two were still here. I miss you, mom and dad."^^... You probably shouldn't have read that. You put the ripped paper back where it was.
Entries.SophiaHouse.38: You look at yourself in the mirror. You're looking dapper today!
Entries.SophiaHouse.39: The toilet was cleaned recently. It's very shiny!
Entries.SophiaHouse.40: This radio has anime stickers on it.
Entries.SophiaHouse.41: Sophia plays with toys when she takes baths. Seeing the toy sailboat in the water fills you with determination.
Entries.SophiaHouse.42: It's a picture of the mountain range by Grampleton.
Entries.SophiaHouse.43: There's family photos on the wall. Sophia looks like she was around six or seven years old.
Entries.SophiaHouse.44: You see the Ferngill Republic on the globe.
Entries.SophiaHouse.45: This is Sophia's bed. Her favorite color is yellow!
Entries.SophiaHouse.46: This phone console has three unread voicemails.
Entries.SophiaCellar.1: There's jam being made in this barrel!
Entries.SophiaCellar.2: It's a moving box labled "Family Photos".
Entries.SophiaCellar.4: Oh, these aren't kegs, they're casks! And there are so many of them! These have been fermenting wine for a long time. Sophia must be making Blue Moon Vineyard's trademark iridium quality grape wine.
Entries.SophiaCellar.5: It's a piece of paper with documenation on some numbers for the vineyard. You take a glance at it:^"MANIFEST - BLUE MOON VINEYARD - 518.16.02-83"^^"EXPENSES: 134,416G"^"INCOME: 284,728G"^"PROFITS FOR 83RD QUARTER: 150,312G"^^... There's more to the manifest, but you stop reading it because you're bored and don't feel like looking at numbers anymore.
Entries.SusanHouse.1: "!!ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS!!"^^"PAGE 5 - 08.63-02"^"1x4x49-1/2"^"18-1/2x43-1/2"^"1x4x49-1/2"^"Assemble top by drilling pocket holes as shown and screwing together 1-1/4 pocket hole screws."^^Hmm... looks like a manual Susan is using to make a storage chest.
Entries.SusanHouse.2: It's a wood crafting hammer, made at Grampleton!
Entries.SusanHouse.3: Susan is almost done crafting this foot stool.
Entries.SusanHouse.4: Wow! This chest has excellent craftsmanship!
Entries.SusanHouse.5: "Woodworking Basics - Mastering the Essentials of Craftsmanship"
Entries.SusanHouse.7: "The Mini Farming Guide to Fermenting Wine"
Entries.SusanHouse.8: There's tacs on the globe indicating where Susan has traveled to. She's been all over the world!
Entries.SusanHouse.9: The radio is set to a news station.
Entries.SusanHouse.10: It's a replica model of the J.R. FORSONT ship. It was famous for charting the entire Gem Sea.
Entries.SusanHouse.11: Susan's laptop is password protected. You type in "Password". It doesn't work. You don't know what you expected.
Entries.SusanHouse.12: So many plants! Susan has a green thumb.
Entries.SusanHouse.13: Hmm... Susan is taking a quota on the next seasonal seeds.
Entries.SusanHouse.14: This microwave smells like vegan hot pockets.
Entries.SusanHouse.15: The stove top is crystal clean.
Entries.SusanHouse.16: What's in the fridge? Whoa! Most of the contents in this fridge are fruits and vegetables. Susan probably doesn't eat meat.
Entries.SusanHouse.17: You want to take a peek in the dresser, but you know better than to do that. It's rude.
Entries.SusanHouse.18: Susan's bed is green, her favorite color.
Entries.SusanHouse.19: Whoa! This is a Celestron NexsStar LX6000! This must be worth over 20,000G! Susan must enjoy stargazing.
Entries.SusanHouse.20: It's a ripped page from Susan's diary:^"I'm so excited I finally get to take a trip to the Fern Islands! I had to save up a lot of money to take this trip. The culture and architecture will be a spectacular experience, not to mention the beautiful weather and beaches!"^^... You're wishing you could take a vacation at the Fern Islands.
Entries.SusanHouse.21: A "Super Waluigi Brothers" game cartridge is in the console.
Entries.SusanHouse.22: These casks are fermenting various wines and juices from fruits and vegetables Susan harvested from her crop fields. The wine and juice are transported via train to multiple provinces in the Ferngill Republic.
Entries.SusanHouse.23: This is a type writer. Susan uses it to make reports and manifests of her farm.
Entries.SusanHouse.27: "EMERALD FARM MANIFEST FOR 39TH QUARTER - 5-32.93"^^"EXPENSES: 41,704G"^"INCOME: 70,306G"^"PROFIT: 28,602G"^^"SHIPMENT TO PINE-MESA CITY: CODE 60-01.06"^"60 KG - Produce"^"7 Gallons - Wine"^"13 Gallons - Juice"^^"SIGNATURE AUTHORIZATION: S.S.R. RONSON"^"TARIFFS: 3069.06 - 9"
Entries.SusanHouse.28: This wood is used for crafting.
Entries.AndyHouse.3: "Why Joja Farming is Better Than Organic Methods"
Entries.AndyHouse.5: The radio doesn't have a battery in it...
Entries.AndyHouse.6: This cup smells bad. It hasn't been cleaned.
Entries.AndyHouse.9: Beer is soaked in the carpet.
Entries.AndyHouse.10: There's rotten food spilling out of the can.
Entries.AndyHouse.11: You open the fridge to see what's in it. Let's see... there's some groceries purchased from the Joja department store.
Entries.AndyHouse.12: This plant is trying its best to grow, but you doubt it'll survive given the state of Andy's house. Knowing this to be true depresses you.
Entries.AndyHouse.13: This trash can is filled with garbage... it's also omitting a horrible odor.
Entries.AndyHouse.14: The sink has a lot of dirty dishes.
Entries.AndyHouse.15: This oven hasn't been cleaned in forever.
Entries.AndyHouse.17: Andy's bed has mud in it...
Entries.AndyHouse.18: It's a Joja shopping basket. Andy probably never returned it.
Entries.AndyHouse.20: It's a manifest of Fairhaven farm. You take a look:^^"FAIRHAVEN FARM REPORT FOR 41ST QUARTER"^^"INCOME: 24,540G"^"EXPENSES: 29,307G"^"NET LOSS: 4,767G"^"NEXT SHIPPING DATE CODE: 305-14.06"^^Hmm... Andy is losing money from his operations. Maybe its the quality of the seeds he's using?
Entries.AndyHouse.21: "My Yoba darn plants keep dyin' and aren't producing enough. I gotta buy more of dem Joja fertilizers. That ought to do the trick."^^... You put the paper back where it was.

It's a recipe book of Gotoro wine fermentation practices. This is banned in the Ferngill Republic. Olivia must be hiding this...^^(You put the paper back)
Entries.JenkinsHouse.37: "Mystical Creatures of Stardew Valley - First Edition"
Entries.JenkinsHouse.38: "Grampleton - Travel Guide"^^(This book in particular interests you. You take a glance through the pages)^^Hmm... there are many images of golden fields of wheat, windmills, wood work, and a small community of happy people! The trees surrounding the tiny village are huge!
Entries.JenkinsHouse.39: "The First Slash - Monster Hunter Clan of Fern Islands"^^The cover image of this book shows five people with blue cloaks. These must be the adventurers across the Gem Sea! You wonder if Marlon knows any of them.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.41: "Stories of the Smoluanu - by M. Jasper"^^Hmm... This book talks about the Dwarves that used to live in Corneal Mountain over a thousand years ago.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.43: You see Pine-Mesa City on the globe. You wonder how mom and dad are doing...
Entries.JenkinsHouse.44: This art is beautiful. Olivia loves painting.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.45: Olivia is painting the palm tree.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.46: There's various oils, paints, and custom crafted brushes in this shelve. These look expensive.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.47: Used of tubes of paint are on the floor.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.48: It's Olivia's work desk. The drawer is locked. You wonder what's in it?
Entries.JenkinsHouse.49: This office cabinet is locked. There's probably boring stuff in it anyway.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.50: There's a peice of paper with notes on it:^^"STOCK TRADE DATE: 04.24.1998-01.5 14:30"^"CONTACT: BARABAR RUSH - (624) 520-10532"^"CURRENCY TRANSLATION: 1G --- 0.845Z"^^... You don't really understand any of this.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.53: You were going to look through Olivia's dresser, but you should know better.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.54: The bedsheets are made of Gotoro Empire silk. This must have cost a ton of money.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.55: It's a ripped piece of paper from Olivia's diary. You wonder to yourself why everyone in Stardew Valley keeps leaving ripped pieces of their diary out... you read it:^^"Another lovely day in Pelican Town! The stock market has been very kind to me as of late. I made 150,000G from a stock trade I made today! I'll spend this money on more extravagant wine to add to my collection! Or perhaps I'll to add to my millions in my trust fund. So many questions. So little time! Hahaha!"^^(You put the ripped piece of paper back where it was)
Entries.JenkinsHouse.56: There's incense, candles, fancy towels, and various toiletries.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.59: It's a bathtub. You can clean yourself in these, or so you've heard.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.60: It's another Super Neendo Entertainment System. Victor has two of these!?
Entries.JenkinsHouse.61: Whoa! This is a minature G-40 TV! This must have cost a lot!
Entries.JenkinsHouse.62: Victor's bed is made of silk from the Gotoro Empire.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.63: To satisfy your curiosity, you take a peak in Victor's dresser...^^Hmm... he has boxers with hearts on them!
Entries.JenkinsHouse.68: "Engineering - Applications in Practice"^^You notice the price tag. This book cost 5,250G...
Entries.JenkinsHouse.71: It's a ripped piece of paper from Victor's diary. You're filled with joy you can read it! You dive right into it:^^"After a year of graduating from Pellcar University with my engineering degree, I'm not... sure what I want to do with my life. I was offered an internship in Zuzu City at a well known company but I... turned it down. I never told mom. She would be furious if she found out. I need more time to think about what I want to do. Not what others want."^^(You put the paper back)
Entries.JenkinsHouse.72: This Gotoro cabinet has Gotoro Empire dishes in it. These look extremely expensive.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.73: The microwave has a pizza hot pocket in it. Victor may have forgotten it?
Entries.JenkinsHouse.74: Wow. This is a Garland series electric range stove. This is probably worth more than Marnie's livestock combined.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.75: It's an Algren staineless steel kitchen sink.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.76: You open the fridge and find it packed full of expensive food bought from Pierre's General Store.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.77: This dining room table was built in Grampleton. You can tell by the excellent craftsmanship. This must have been a custom order.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.79: This bear statue was hand carved in Grampleton.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.80: There is an assortment of cookies and tea. You want to take a cookie, but you know you shouldn't.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.81: There's many objects. They look expensive too.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.83: These are freshly cut logs from Grampleton.
Entries.JenkinsHouse.84: "27 shades of Yellow - The tale of finding the other 23 shades"
Entries.ForestWest.3: This shipping bin is bolted shut.
Entries.ForestWest.4: It's a rusty sword. There's desciptions on the blade, but they're too faded to decipher.
Entries.ForestWest.5: This is a Lava Katana! These swords are forged in pools of churning lava at Mt. Volvos. There's only 100 of these swords in the world. You want to take the blade out of the ground, but you respect who laid it here.
Entries.ForestWest.6: These bottles were thrown out into this abandoned field recently.
Entries.ForestWest.9: There are various pieces of machinery buried in the ground here. They look expensive. Was someone working on a large project here before abandoning it?

Entries.OliviaCellar.1: This radio is playing classical music. The violin sounds beautiful.
Entries.OliviaCellar.2: There are pins locating every vineyard in the Ferngill Republic. Blue Moon Vineyard is on here too.
Entries.OliviaCellar.3: These casks are harboring expensive foreign wine. All of these casks are probably worth more than your house.

Entries.Egg-Festival.1: You fill your plate with ham, eggs, greens, and some rolls! You eat it in one sitting with some orange juice. It was delicious!
Entries.Egg-Festival.2: Aren't you a little too old to play with this?
Entries.Beach-Luau.1: You know this song! You want to sing the lyrics, but you can't sing that well...
Entries.Beach-Luau.2: You help yourself to some glazed ham, radish salad, and some bread rolls. You wash it all down with hand-crafted iridium quality grape wine from Blue Moon Vineyard! Yum!
Entries.Beach-Luau.3: Linus sure does know how to slow roast ham!
Entries.Beach-Luau.4: These statues resemble the culture of the Tiki tribe, one of the local habitants of Fern Islands!
Entries.Beach-Luau.5: You see something moving in the water... hmm, whatever it was, it's gone. Must have just been your imagination.
Entries.Town-Fair.1: TOURIST: "I think I've eaten around 4,000 calories worth of food so far... Totally. Freaking. Worth. It. This BBQ sauce is to die for, man!"
Entries.Town-Fair.2: GOLIATH: "HEY THERE, KIDDO. I SEE YOU EYEING SOMEONE YOU FANCY. YOU CAN'T HIDE THAT FROM ME. I, GOLIATH, SEE ALL. THIS STRENGTH GAME WILL SURELY IMPRESS EM, IF YOU HAVE THE STRENGTH THAT IS! HAHAHA!!"
Entries.Town-Fair.3: CLOWN: "Impressed that I can juggle one ball at a time? Maybe if I got paid another 200g an hour I would juggle two balls at a time with both hands."
Entries.Town-Fair.4: TOURIST: "All of these grange displays are impressive. It's amazing how well everyone here in Stardew Valley showcases their expertise."
Entries.Town-Fair.5: TOURIST: "I visit Stardew Valley every year for the fair. I brought little Timothy along this time!"
Entries.Town-Fair.6: TOURIST: "Hey, you're the owner of that farm down there aren't ya? I heard about you in the paper a while ago. You cleaned that farm up good! Keep up the good work."
Entries.Town-Fair.7: REBECCA: "Hi there! My name is Rebecca. I'm a friend of these two dorks here hehe. I live in Zuzu City and I came here for the Stardew Festival. I'll catch you around, sweetie!"
Entries.Town-Fair.8: TOURIST: "Hey there, buddy. I'm taking a break from this rigged slingshot game right now. I swear, it's as if ConcernedApe didn't know how to properly implement projectile weapons in this game."
Entries.Town-Fair.9: TOURIST: "A... Shooting Comet cocktail? I sure could go for one of those right now. This festival is making me thirsty."
Entries.Town-Fair.10: TOURIST: "I just had my fortune told by this creepy lady right here. She told me I'd get killed in the mines... just what the heck is she on about?"
Entries.Town-Fair.11: TOURIST: "You want to take this pumpkin home, boo?"
Entries.Town-Fair.12: WORKER: "Oh, hey. I'm just taking a "quick" break from moving these barrels. Can you believe I'm only getting paid 300g an hour for this? pfft..."
Entries.Town-Fair.13: TOURIST: "That cheese wheel is huge! I wonder if that lady would be willing to sell it?"
Entries.Town-Fair.14: TOURIST: "Ohhh! This is the pumpkin we should bring back home! It'll make the perfect Jack-o-lantern, honey!"
Entries.Town-Fair.15: TOURIST: "Dude... That pumpkin doesn't look natural."
Entries.Town-Fair.16: TOURIST: "Maaaann, that pumpkin is huge! Bro, let's take a picture of it. Scarlett would never believe us, man!"
Entries.Town-Fair.17: TOURIST: "I must say, Stardew Valley is spectacular this time of year. I came all the way from Chestervale just to get a pumpkin! The best crops are grown here in this very valley! The soil is extremely rich here because of a meteor shower a long time ago!"
Entries.Town-Fair.18: TOURIST: "Sigh... I'm horrible at throwing darts. There goes another 15g."
Entries.Town-Fair.19: GIL: "I see you strayed away from the crowd, farmer... or should I say adventurer? You've been venturing forth deep into the mines, or so Marlon tells me. This is as good as an opportunity than any... You're doing the Guild proud. Thank you. Now, you should go back and enjoy yourself, adventurer."
Entries.Town-Fair.20: That creepy old bald man is littering everywhere...
Entries.Town-Fair.21: Someone just threw their popcorn onto the ground instead of throwing it away in the trash...
Entries.Town-Fair.22: It's a soda can, that's not from Joja.
Entries.Town-Fair.23: Pierre has an extraordinary grange display! These are the crops he's been growing all year in his backyard.
Entries.Town-Fair.24: Marnie's grange display is remarkable! These artisan goods are out of this world.
Entries.Town-Fair.25: Willy caught a Dorado!? Wow! That seriously takes some skill.
Entries.Town-Fair.26: This pumpkin is massive. Good luck to anyone trying to take this one home.
Entries.Town-Fair.27: The farmers of Stardew Valley contributed their own pumpkins to this patch so TOURISTs can take pumpkins home with them.
Entries.Town-Fair.28: Yup. This is the best pumpkin here.
Entries.Town-Fair.29: This couple sitting down by the river is having a heated argument... better leave them alone.
Entries.Town-Fair.30: She's trying to use the swing. Should maybe get out of her way or she'll kick you...
Entries.Town-Fair.31: Yo! I'll climb this with just one hand!
Entries.Town-Fair.32: It's Sebastian's motorcycle. He drove down here? His house isn't even that far away.
Entries.Town-Fair.33: Someone was playing kick-ball here recently.
Entries.Town-Fair.34: Clint is displaying high-quality bronze, iron, and gold bars. There's also some weapons he crafted, plus a shield! These are superb!
Entries.Town-Fair.35: CREEPY MAN: "You cheated to talk to me, didn't you? Well, if you were trying to find a secret by talking to me, I wouldn't tell you anyway."
Entries.Town-Fair.36: This is Andy's grange display. He's displaying his produce from this season. There isn't much here. Andy seems proud of his work.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.1: This chest is fake! You've been bamboozled.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.2: You walked past these scary spiders only to find a fake treasure chest. Now you have to walk past the scary spiders again.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.3: X X X WARNING!!! X X X MONSTERS AHEAD!!! X X X^^"Please be wary of deadly monsters in this part of the maze. If you choose to continue further, you are responsible for your own life and wellbeing."^^-M. Rasmodius^^
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.5: This house has weird looking feet...
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.6: You can tell the chest behind the graves is fake. Alex is wasting his time... good. Let's go find the real chest.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.7: This cauldron smells like cotton candy for some reason. You want to taste it, but you really shouldn't.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.8: JACK THE PUMPKIN: "Hi there! Good job on completing the maze! This chest up here has some amazing awards for you. By the way, these monsters are all fake and won't hurt you. If you already found that out by yourself, I'm not sorry for tricking you!"
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.9: These spiders are fake, but they sure do look real. You're feeling glad that there aren't spider monsters in the mines.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.10: Someone is being eaten alive by spiders over there. That's what happens if you try to cheat in the maze.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.11: These lanterns around the fountain have blue flames. They look very spooky!
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.12: You help yourself to some ham, potatoes, greens, and some pumpkin pie with whip cream! You wash it down with some wine from Blue Moon Vineyard. Delicious!
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.13: There's a monster blocking the path up ahead... better turn around and find another way.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.14: These skeletons look menacing. If it weren't for this metal cage, they'd be top of us in an instant.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.15: This pumpkin is blocking the path, and it's not like you can simply walk around it. Best to turn around...
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.16: These pumpkins were grown by Pierre, Marnie, Susan, and Pelican Town's community garden. Emily carved all of them herself!
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.17: You open the chest and find a note. You read it:^^"You cheated not only the game, but yourself. You didn't grow. You didn't improve. You took a shortcut and gained nothing. You experienced a hollow victory. Nothing was risked and nothing was gained. It's sad that you don't know the difference."
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.18: It's Marlon's sword. The craftsmanship is superb.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.19: Gil's sword is leaning against the Mullner's mailbox.
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.20: GIL: "Marlon and an adventurer from Castle Village caught these monsters a couple days ago. These monsters are fierce. Don't get close to the cages."
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.21: THE PUMPKIN KING: "Hi. Thank you for taking the time to talk to me. You're a nice person. Happy Spirits Eve!"
Entries.Spirits-Eve-Festival.22: AAAAAHHHHHHH!!!!^^...^^Oh, it's just Dusty. Who's a good boy!? You are!
Entries.Ice-Festival.2: Looks like someone was drinking here.
Entries.Ice-Festival.3: You want to lick this candy cane, but you shouldn't.
Entries.Ice-Festival.4: It's an igloo! Linus built most of these.
Entries.Ice-Festival.5: Looks like the ruins of a long forgotten temple...
Entries.Ice-Festival.6: Could this possibly be magic? Maybe, just maybe.
Entries.Ice-Festival.8: Robin built an ice sand castle. Amazing!
Entries.Ice-Festival.9: This ice statue looks like a pear!
Entries.Ice-Festival.10: The Ice-Festival takes place several miles deep into Cindersap Forest.
Entries.Ice-Festival.11: A tent all the way out here in the forest? It looks like it's Linus'. He must have come out here in advance and set his tent up. I think he's going to be hanging around here for a bit longer when everyone goes back to town.
Entries.Ice-Festival.12: Looks like Willy already caught several fish. He must have been practicing for the competition. Too bad he's going to lose to me!
Entries.Town-Winter-Star.1: Linus built an igloo in town. He's quite skilled at making these! I wonder if he'll teach me how to make one?
Entries.Town-Winter-Star.2: You pack your plate full of turkey, mashed potatoes, greens, and some rolls! You eat it all in one sitting! You wash it all down with some apple cider. Delicious! Gus outdid himself!
Entries.Town-Winter-Star.3: You want to lick the candy cane... and you do. Eww! It's plastic. You shouldn't have licked it...
Entries.Town-Winter-Star.4: These presents are wrapped beautifully! You wonder which one is yours?... Oh, none of them have name tags. You'll have to wait and see who gives you your present!
Entries.FarmMod.1: "AMY"^"BELOVED WIFE AND MOTHER"^"Yoba knows you had to leave me, but you did not go alone. For part of me went with you. Rest in peace, my tiger lily."
